title: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
Just wondering, have any of you had any commander keen related dreams?

Personally, i say no, but i remember somthing from 'Keen Dreams' that apparently dosn't exist, but im sure it was real...95% sure...

Anyway yeah, had any dreams?

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
I THINK I have... Don't remember much from it anymore. What was it that you dreamt of?___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content: i must have dreamt something about the Miragia desert some time when i was a kid. that place always thrilled me alot!

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
More than once.. I've described some of them somewhere here in the forums.
Anyways, mostly my Keen related dreams have been about the game itself; there being some strange bugs or playing some levels that actually doesn't exist.

And then there's garg(oid)s.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img] I prefer not describing those dreams here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

And, in some dreams I've seen some other Keeners, although I had no idea what they looked like. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
I *apparenly* had a dream of playing a night time level in keen dreams.... I KNOW i played the level why is everyone saying it was a dream [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

unless it was a fan game, but these was a long while ago before many fan games were out.

And so many things from the *dream* make sence now... i really think there are hidden levels in kdreams.

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
If I remember correct there is one hidden level that can't be accessed any other way than by using the warp cheat. However, my memory is fuzzy and I should play more Keen Dreams to find out whether it's a normal level afterall, or not.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content: Indeed, the secret level(s) in Keen Dreams can only be accessed via the warp cheat. There's four or so of these 'secret levels', isn't there? IIRK, they all have identical layouts, too.

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content: how do i access them? like how do i get the warp to work

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content: The warp cheat is F10 + W. Then select levels 6, 8, 11 or 13.

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content: I just tried the warp cheats and noticed that the secret levels won't work with the registered version of the game. There just comes errors like out of memory etc. the same stuff that comes when you try to play a level higher than 15 in Keen 5. It seems like they did everything possible in order to make the registered version to fit on that small disk.

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
Ah, it seems they have removed the pointless non-accessible levels from that version, then.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Commander Keen in Dreams
content:
They were *going* to be fully functional however, I guess time n diskspace were more important back then.

*sigh*A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
